title: regression 1.52 - proc-macro-hack panic

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: relnotes
labels.description: Marks issues that should be documented in the release notes of the next release.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
proc-macro-hack is panicking[1] on beta 1.52 in some cases where it wasn't before:

* [base](https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/beta-1.52-1/1.51.0/gh/FIL1994.expense-tracker/log.txt) vs. [beta](https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/beta-1.52-1/beta-2021-03-27/gh/FIL1994.expense-tracker/log.txt)
* [base](https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/beta-1.52-1/1.51.0/gh/FIL1994.tower-web-app/log.txt) vs. [beta](https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/beta-1.52-1/beta-2021-03-27/gh/FIL1994.tower-web-app/log.txt)

My guess is this might have something to do with the usize-suffixed tuple indices, but I'm not sure. It seems to be new behavior on beta; I don't know whether this is caused by any of the recently landed macro-related patches, but it seems not impossible.

[1]: This is my belief, as it's the only repository in the dependency tree to contain the 'source.starts_with(prefix)' string in its source code (based on cargo vendor).

cc @Aaron1011 @petrochenkov @dtolnay 

edit - some more cases:

* https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/beta-1.52-1/beta-2021-03-27/gh/bryanburgers.connectbot/log.txt
